channel.title: Bitmap
channel.description:
Ok guys heres a bitmap question
Say i have a macro check for this game
It shows a image with 3 letters and the bitmaps are always the same but the background is a different hue every time i get one of these so im wondering how i can so it where say i cut out the l the a and the o in the bitmap below without the blue background?
like i know the tutorials say cut it out and use a black background but the text is black will scar still reconize the black text? What do i do>?

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mako:

if i make the letters white on the bitmaps but keep the background black it will still find the letters correctly even though they are normally black?

Yes. If you have white characters with a black background, it will find them.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.description:
@_11 wrote:

yeh, for tuts on makling bitmaps look in the scar section theres a feqw there.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @Mako Mako
item.description:
@Mako wrote:

if i make the letters white on the bitmaps but keep the background black it will still find the letters correctly even though they are normally black?

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:23285”]If you blacken everything except the letters, then scar will ignore everything in black and only search for those letters.

Though if your letters are black, I don’t see how scar will recognize them. :([/quote]

You make the letters white/use a white background.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @Mako Mako
item.description:
@Mako wrote:

What is a bitmap mask and how would i do this?

I’ve tryed deformed bitmaps but no luck mabe some one can help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

couldn’t you do a bitmap mask?

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

If you blacken everything except the letters, then scar will ignore everything in black and only search for those letters.

Though if your letters are black, I don’t see how scar will recognize them.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitmap
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

First of all… Go back and read what you have just said, and then tell me if you can understand it.
Well I would prefer just cutting out the letters and leaving the white background on it, it doesn’t really matter.

Read full topic
